sentences.english: Which, of course—as Patty told the other mothers—struck Joey as an outrage.
sentences.chinese: 帕蒂告诉其他妈妈，乔伊当然对此愤愤不平。

sentences.english: I angrily whet a tooth and toward altitude of brain ground flower petal to jilt a green rattan.
sentences.chinese: 我愤愤的磨着牙，对着头顶地花瓣甩出一根青藤。

sentences.english: The British government huffed and puffed at the commission's decision.
sentences.chinese: 英国政府对委员会的决定愤愤不满。

sentences.english: Over there, the aggrieved, jun has been seeking private detective, investigating Carrie.
sentences.chinese: 那边厢，愤愤不平的日君已访寻私家侦探，调查嘉莉。

sentences.english: She began to rage against her bad luck.
sentences.chinese: 她开始愤愤地叙说自己的倒霉事。

sentences.english: He turned and flung off without a word.
sentences.chinese: 他转过身去，一言不发愤愤离去。

sentences.english: My sister and I listen to and gnash, resentfully to walk home.
sentences.chinese: 我和姐姐听了，气得咬牙切齿，愤愤不平地走回家去。

sentences.english: Miners have complained bitterly that the government did not fulfill their promises.
sentences.chinese: 矿工们愤愤不平地抱怨说政府没有履行诺言。

sentences.english: He is on the phone again, raging about the horrible way his boss treats him.
sentences.chinese: 他又在打电话了，愤愤地叙说着老板对他的蛮横态度。

sentences.english: The wife or widow of a margrave.
sentences.chinese: 侯爵夫人愤愤地说，“你真是太傻，太孩子气了。

definition: variant of 憤憤|愤愤[fen4 fen4]
variant of 憤憤不平|愤愤不平[fen4 fen4 bu4 ping2]
gnashing one's teeth (idiom); displaying extreme anger/fuming with rage between gritted teeth
to swear while talking/to be foul-mouthed
